com.tokelon.toktales.android.render.tools

Interface IUIOverlay

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    UIOverlay

    public interface IUIOverlay

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int BUTTON_A 
      static int BUTTON_B 
      static int BUTTON_NONE 
      static int BUTTON_SET 
      static int BUTTON_SP1 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getButton(int x, int y)
      Get the button this point is on.

      Following values can be returned:
      - BUTTON_OUTSIDE If the point is not inside any button.
      Otherwise one of the button codes BUTTON_A, BUTTON_B.
      Rect getButtonBounds(int button)
      Note that the returned values do not define the button's shape, only the button's bounds.
      void getButtonBounds(int button, Rect result)
      Writes the bounds for the given button into the given rectangle.

      Note that the returned values do not define the button's shape, only the button's bounds.
      IButtonOverlayView getButtonView(int button) 
      ICrossControlOverlayView getCrossControlView() 
      boolean isInButtonBounds(int button, int x, int y)
      Find out if a given point is inside a button's bounds.

    • Method Detail

      • getCrossControlView

        ICrossControlOverlayView getCrossControlView()

      • getButtonView

        IButtonOverlayView getButtonView(int button)

      • getButtonBounds

        Rect getButtonBounds(int button)
        Note that the returned values do not define the button's shape, only the button's bounds.
        Parameters:
        button - The button which bounds should be returned.
        Returns:
        A new rectangle containing the bounds for the given button.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If button is not one of the known button codes.

      • getButtonBounds

        void getButtonBounds(int button,
                     Rect result)
        Writes the bounds for the given button into the given rectangle.

        Note that the returned values do not define the button's shape, only the button's bounds.
        Parameters:
        button - The button which bounds should be returned.
        result - The rectangle to use for the result.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If button is not one of the known button codes.

      • isInButtonBounds

        boolean isInButtonBounds(int button,
                         int x,
                         int y)
        Find out if a given point is inside a button's bounds.
        Parameters:
        button - The button which bounds will be checked.
        x - The horizontal value of the point.
        y - The vertical value of the point.
        Returns:
        True if the point is on the given button.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If button is not one of the known button codes.

      • getButton

        int getButton(int x,
              int y)
        Get the button this point is on.

        Following values can be returned:
        - BUTTON_OUTSIDE If the point is not inside any button.
        Otherwise one of the button codes BUTTON_A, BUTTON_B.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal value of the point.
        y - The vertical value of the point.
        Returns:
        The code of the button this point is on.
